title: P127. Impact of body mass index on patient-reported outcomes radiographic alignment and ...

summary.text: **KEY FINDING**: Patients with BMI ≥35 had higher in-hospital complication rates (2.0% vs 7.8%, p=0.032).
**TACTICAL WIN [ROADMAP]**: Develop tailored ePRO modules focusing on pain management for high-BMI patients.
**MARKET SIGNAL [⚫ CONTEXT]**: BMI is an emerging factor in PRO studies, warranting further investigation.
**CONCERN**: Self-selection bias may affect the representativeness of high-BMI patient cohort.
